intro: Acalyphes, commonly known as the flame tree, is a tropical plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its large, showy, flame-colored flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are usually dark green and glossy. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated as an ornamental tree. The fruit is a small, three-lobed capsule that contains several seeds.
